result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose R Gonzalez-Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 1/3/2019.  Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
-Fine set at zero.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for four (4) days,  4/17/2015 to 4/20-2015.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program, only after serving 12 months of Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed.
Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $500.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
Not to associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
No contact with Luis R. dob 4/16/1991.

Complete parenting or fatherhood course.
Fine set at zero.
Driver's license suspension is not imposed.
Partcipate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

Court advised the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose R Gonzalez-Torres

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to WISCONSIN DEPT OF CORRECTIONS-DRUG ABUSE CORRECTIONAL CENTER. 4280 NORTH SHERMAN RD. PO BOX 36, WINNEBAGO, WI 54985-0036. FAXED TO: 920-424-0430.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order- ERP, signed and filed.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

1/22/16 mail notice to attorney regarding bail assignment on file no sealed and should be submitted with a notary seal.
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Batholomew.

Defendant Jose R Gonzalez-Torres in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS and 9 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days (04-17-2015 to 04-20-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS 9 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  2 YEARS.  

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program, only after serving 12 months of initial confinement. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 01-31-2019; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $500.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
- Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with Luis R. (DOB 04-16-1991).
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Exhibit List Jury Trial received and filed.

" We, the jury, find the defendant, Jose R. Gonzalez-Torres, guilty of possession with intent to deliver a controlled substance, as party to a crime, as charge in the information. If you find the defendant guilty of possession with intent to deliver a controlled substance, as a party to a crime, you must answer the following question yes or no. Was the amount of Cocaine, including the weight of any other substance or material mixed or combined with it, possessed with intent to deliver more than 5 grams. YES. Before you may answer this question "yes" you must be satisfied beyond a reasonable doubt that the amount possessed with intent to deliver was more than 5 grams."

Defendant Jose R. Gonzalez in court with attorney Michale F. Torphy. Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk: tmk
Sworn as interpreter: Ruth Garcia. 

Jury in the box at 1:46 pm. Court instructed the jury. Closing arguments. Sidebar requested. Side bar requestesd. Jury out of the box at 2:36 pm. Side bar placed on the record. Legal argument. Jury in the box at 3:17. Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released. Jury retired at the hour of 3:25 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Berlin and Rutter who were duly sworn for that purpose. 
Sworn as interpreter: Liesl Monroy.  

At the hour of 4:47 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of Guilty which was then read.  

 " We, the jury, find the defendant, Jose R. Gonzalez-Torres, guilty of possession with intent to deliver a controlled substance, as party to a crime, as charge in the information. If you find the defendant guilty of possession with intent to deliver a controlled substance, as a party to a crime, you must answer the following question yes or no. Was the amount of Cocaine, including the weight of any other substance or material mixed or combined with it, possessed with intent to deliver more than 5 grams. YES. Before you may answer this question "yes" you must be satisfied beyond a reasonable doubt that the amount possessed with intent to deliver was more than 5 grams."

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court instructed the jury. Jury out of the box at 4:53 pm.Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. 

Court REITERATES conditions of bail. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 01-15-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17.
